chargeHist.descr: Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Xavier A Watkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Great Harm, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(a).
  • Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Bodily Harm), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.
All court costs, surcharges to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with revocation sentence; and concurrent with count two.
*March 6, 2017  Credit of 106 days granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.

No further violations of the law.
No controlled substances without a valid prescrption. 
No unsupervised contact with any children under the age of 16  unless approved by the agent.
No contact with firearms.

Complete a course in anger management.
Attend parenting classes.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction, he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he must provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, his voting rights are suspended and he may never possess firearms.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with revocation sentence; and concurrent with count one.
*March 6, 2017 Credit of 106 days granted.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Xavier A Watkins in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Xavier A Watkins in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
PSI reviewed by the parties.  No corrections made.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Additional statements made by Santia G., Monica W. and Vivian W.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 10 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, concurrent with revocation sentence and concurrent with Count 2; credit for 0 days served.  Court ordered 5 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 5 YEARS Extended Supervision.
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 6 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, concurrent with revocation sentence and concurrent with Count 1; credit for 0 days served.  Court ordered 3 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 3 YEARS Extended Supervision.

Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete a course in anger management.
- Attend parenting classes.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- No controlled substances without a valid prescription; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No unsupervised contact with any children under the age of 16 unless approved by the agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. 
.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample, pay the surcharge, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

AS TO COUNT 3:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED AND TO COUNT 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  At request of the parties, Court ordered PSI report.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.

Defendant Xavier A Watkins in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Xavier A Watkins in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Child Abuse, Recklessly Cause Great Bodily Harm, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.03(3)(a), a Class E Felony.

Attorney Andrew Michael Meetz in court, defendant Xavier A Watkins not in court, in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for plea and sentencing.  Court is in trial and cannot hear the matter.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Statement made by Santiea G. Court modifies No Contact Order to allow for phone contact only.

Defendant Xavier A Watkins in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in Court for Scheduling Conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date. Case remains calendared in Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Xavier A Watkins in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Xavier A Watkins in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with NW (dob: 1/20/2015); Santiea G.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Xavier A Watkins in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Xavier A Watkins in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. 
 DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
